Detailed Description

A widget for providing users with interface presets.

This widget provides a means to allow users to select a preset for altering the state of an interface.

bool  includeName = false 
) const [protected, pure virtual]

Retrieves the default settings from the preset widget for the interface and stores them in a settings object.

Sub-classes must implement this function.

Parameters:

includeName Whether the preset name should be included as a setting on the settings object.

bool DzPresetWidget::prependPreset ( const QString &  name,
bool  userDefined = false,
bool  savesToFile = true 
) [protected]

Creates a new preset and put it at the beginning of the list. The active preset is not changed

Parameters:
name The name of the preset
userDefined Whether this should be a user preset or not
savesToFile Whether this preset should be saved to file or not
Returns:
true if the preset was added, false otherwise
bool DzPresetWidget::presetSavesToFile ( const QString &  name  )  [protected]

Determines if the preset with the given name will be saved to the presets file.

Parameters:
name The name of the preset
Returns:
true if the preset saves to file, false if not or if the given preset does not exist

void DzPresetWidget::updateInterface ( const DzSettings &  settings,
bool  blockSignals 
) [protected, pure virtual]

Updates the preset widget interface with the options supplied in the supplied settings object.

Sub-classes must implement this function.

Parameters:
settings The settings object to read the options values from.
blockSignals Whether or not signals should be blocked when making changes to the interface.
